Name: Stela of Ser
Description: The lunette of this stela contains no scenes. Underneath it are two horizontal lines containing the offering formula. In the next register, the mayor and chief of the temple Ser is depicted in front of an offering table. His wife sits opposite him in virtually the same position. She is slightly smaller. Underneath the scene are eleven horizontal lines of inscription, divided into two sections by a vertical stroke in the middle, containing the names and titles of family members. The workmanship of the stela is hasty. Some of the signs on it are in hieratic.
